response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease two 8-inch round pans. Whisk 2 cups flour, 2 cups sugar, ¾ cup cocoa, 2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt in a large bowl until well combined.",
  "step2": "Add 1 cup buttermilk, 1 cup strong coffee (cooled), ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 eggs to the dry ingredients. Mix on medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth and well incorporated, scraping the bowl as needed.",
  "step3": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in pans for 10 minutes.",
  "step4": "Turn cakes out onto a wire rack to cool completely. While cooling, prepare frosting by beating 1 cup softened butter with 3 cups powdered sugar and ¾ cup cocoa until creamy.",
  "step5": "Add ⅓ cup milk and 1 tsp vanilla to the frosting. Beat on high for 3 minutes until light and fluffy. If too thick, add more milk; if too thin, add more powdered sugar.",
  "step6": "Place one cake layer on a plate. Spread with frosting. Top with second layer and frost the top and sides. Decorate as desired. Slice and serve to 8 happy guests!"
}
